AccountDeleteConfirmMsg: Delete account, do you need to proceed?
AccountExportTips: The exported information contains encrypted account information involving sensitive information, and the export format is an encrypted zip file (if no encryption password has been set, please set the file encryption password in personal information).
AccountHelpText: The cloud account is used to connect to the cloud service providers, allowing access to the resources offered by these providers
AccountTemplateUpdateSecretHelpText: Account list displays accounts created via template. Updating cipher text will also update the cipher text of accounts created through the template.
AccountsHelp:
All Accounts: All accounts already added on the asset;
Specified Account: Usernames of accounts under specified assets;
Manual Account: Username/password entered manually when logging in;
Identical Accounts: Accounts with usernames identical to the authorized person's;
ActionsTips: The roles of various permissions are not the same, click the icon behind the permission to view
AdDomainHelpText: AD Domain Name Provided for Domain User Login
AddAllMembersWarningMsg: Are you sure you want to add all members?
AddRolePermissions: After successful Creation/Update, add permissions in details
AdminUserListHelpMessage: Privileged Users are existing system users of assets with advanced permissions, such as root or users with 'NOPASSWD: ALL' sudo rights. JumpServer uses these users to 'push system users' and 'collect asset hardware data' etc.
AnonymousAccountTip: Username and password are not used when connecting to assets. Only web type and custom type assets are supported.
ApiKeyList:
Authenticate using Api key signature in the request header, each request header is different, it's more secure than Token method, please refer to the documentation for use;
To reduce the risk of leakage, Secret can only be viewed at the time of its creation, each user can create up to 10
ApiKeyWarning: To mitigate the risk of AccessKey leaks, the Secret is only provided at creation, and cannot be queried subsequently, please save properly.
AppletHelpText: During the upload process, if the application does not exist, create the application; if it exists, update the application.
AppletHostDetail: Details of Remote Application Publishing Machine
AppletHostDomainHelpText: This Domain belongs to System Organization
AppletHostSelectHelpMessage:
When connecting to an asset, the choice of application publishing machine is random (but prioritizes the one used last time). If you want to assign a fixed publishing machine for an asset, you can specify the tag or ;
When choosing an account to connect to the publisher, the following cases will use the user's same-name account or proprietary account (starting with js), otherwise, use the public account (starting with jms)：
  1. Both the publisher and the application support concurrency;
  2. The publisher supports concurrency, the application does not support concurrency, and the current application does not use a proprietary account;
  3. The publisher does not support concurrency, the application supports or does not support concurrency, and no application uses a proprietary account;
Note: Whether the application supports concurrency is determined by the developer, the host support depends on Single User Single Session in the publisher configuration
Application: Please enter comma-separated application name groups
ApplyRunSystemUser: System User for the Application Runtime
AssetBulkUpdateTips: Network devices, cloud services, web, do not support batch update of domains
AssetListHelpMessage: On the left is the asset tree, right-click to create, delete, modify tree nodes. The authorization assets are also organized in a node way. On the right are the assets under this node.
AssetLoginACLHelpMsg: When logging into assets, you can audit based on the user's login IP and time period to determine whether the asset can be logged into
AssetPermissionHelpMsg: Asset authorization allows you to select users and assets, and authorize assets to users for access. Once the authorization is complete, users can conveniently browse these assets. In addition, you can also set specific permission bits to further define the user's permission range for assets
AssetProtocolHelpText: The supported protocols of assets are limited by the platform, click the settings button to view the protocol settings. If updates are needed, please update the platform
AuthLdapSearchFilter: Possible options are (cn or uid or sAMAccountName=%(user)s)
AuthLdapUserAttrMap: User Attribute Mapping refers to how to map user attributes in LDAP to jumpserver users, username, name, email are attributes of jumpserver
AuthSAMLCertHelpText: Save after uploading certificate key, then view SP Metadata
AuthSAMLKeyHelpText: SP Certificates and keys are used to encrypt communication with IDP
AuthSaml2UserAttrMapHelpText: The key on the left is the SAML2 user attribute, the value on the right is the authentication platform user attribute
AuthUserAttrMapHelpText: The keys on the left are JumpServer user attributes, and the values on the right are authentication platform user attributes
Author: Author
BadRequestErrorMsg: Request Error, Please Check the Entered Details
BulkCreateStrategy: When creating, for the accounts that do not meet the requirements, such as: non-compliant key type, unique key constraint, you can choose the above policy.
BulkUpdatePlatformHelpText: Only when the original platform type of the asset is the same as the selected platform type, the update will be performed. If the platform types before and after the update are different, the update will not be performed.
CanDragSelect: Time interval can be selected by dragging the mouse
ChangeViewHelpText: Click to switch between different views
ChatHello: Hello! How may I assist you?
ChdirHelpText: Default Action Directory is User's Home Directory
CleanHelpText: The regular cleanup task is performed at 2 AM every day, the data deleted will not be recoverable
CommandFilterACLHelpMsg: Through command filtering, you can control whether commands can be sent to assets. According to the rules you set, some commands can be allowed, while others are prohibited.
CommandFilterHelpMessage:
The system user supports binding multiple command filters to prevent the input of certain commands; multiple rules can be configured in the filter. When using this system user to connect assets, the command input takes effect according to the rule priority configured in the filter.
Example: If the first matched rule is "allow", then the command is executed, if the first matched rule is "deny", then the command is denied; if no rules are matched in the end, it is allowed to execute.
CommandFilterRulePriorityHelpText: The optional priority range is 1-100, with 1 being the lowest priority and 100 being the highest priority
CommentHelpText: Note: The remark information will be displayed on hover in the user authorization asset tree on the Luna page, and ordinary users can view it. Please do not fill in with sensitive information.
ConceptContent: I want you to act like a Python interpreter. I will give you Python code, and you will execute it. Do not provide any explanation. Respond with nothing but the output of the code.
ConnectMethodACLHelpMsg: By filtering through connection methods, you can control whether users can log in to assets using certain connection methods. Based on the rules you set, some connection methods can be allowed, while others may be prohibited (effective globally).
ConnectionTokenList: The connection token is a type of authentication information that combines identity verification and asset connection for use, supporting users to login to the asset with one click. The currently supported components include: KoKo, Lion, Magnus, Razor, etc.
CreateOrgMsg: Please add users in the organization details
CrontabHelpTips:
eg: Execute every Sunday at 03:05 <5 3 * * 0>
Tip: Use a 5-digit Linux crontab expression (online tool)
Note: If both regular execution and periodic execution are set, priority is given to regular execution
CrontabOfCreateUpdatePage:
For example: Execute every Sunday at 03:05 <5 3 * * 0>
Use 5 digit Linux crontab expression (Online Tool)
If both regular execution and cycle execution are set, regular execution is preferred
CustomFile: Please put the customized file in the designated directory (data/sms/main.py), and enable the configuration item SMS_CUSTOM_FILE_MD5=<file md5 value>in config.txt
CustomHelpMessage: Custom type of assets relies on remote applications, please configure it in remote applications in system settings
CustomParams:
On the left are the parameters received by the SMS platform, on the right are the parameters waiting to be formatted by JumpServer, the final is as follows:
{"phone_numbers": "123,134", "content": "The verification code is: 666666"}
DefaultProtocol: Default Protocol, Automatically Selected When Adding Assets
DeleteOrgMsg: User Lists, User Groups, Asset Lists, Network Domain Lists, Management Users, System Users, Tag , Asset Authorization Rules
DeleteOrgTitle: Please ensure the following information within the organization has been erased
DeleteWarningMsg: Are you sure you want to delete
DescribeOfGuide: Welcome to JumpServer Bastion System, Click for More Information
DomainHelpMessage: The domain function is to solve part of the environment that cannot be directly connected (such as mixed cloud) and adds new functions. The principle is to log in through the gateway server redirection. JMS => domain gateway => target assets
DownloadFTPFileTip: The current action does not record files, or the file size exceeds the threshold (default 100M), or it has not yet been saved to the corresponding storage.
DragUploadFileInfo: Drag the file here, or click to upload
DuplicateFileExists: Uploading files with the same name is not allowed. Please delete the duplicate file.
EmailCustomUserCreatedBody: Hint: When creating a user, the content of the password setup email is sent
EmailCustomUserCreatedHonorific: Note: When creating a user, the salutation for sending a password setting email (For example: Hello)
EmailCustomUserCreatedSignature: Hint: The signature of the email (For example: jumpserver)
EmailCustomUserCreatedSubject: Hint: When creating a user, the subject of the email setting the password (For example: User creation successful)
EmailHostPassword: Tip: Some mail providers require a Token.
EmailRecipient: Notice: Only to be used as a test email recipient
EmailSubjectPrefix: Note: Some keywords may be blocked by email providers, such as 'JumpServer'
EmailUserSSL: If the SMTP port is 465, SSL usually needs to be enabled
EmailUserTLS: If the SMTP port is 587, TLS typically needs to be enabled.
EnableKoKoSSHHelpText: Connection to assets shows SSH Client launch method when opened
EndpointListHelpMessage: The service endpoint is the address (port) that the user accesses the service from. When the user connects to the asset, the service endpoint will be selected based on the endpoint rules and asset tags, serving as the access point to establish a connection and implement distributed connection to the assets.
EndpointRuleListHelpMessage:
As for the server endpoint selection strategy, two are currently supported:
1, Specify endpoint based on rules (current page).
2, Choose endpoints through asset tags, the tag is fixed to 'endpoint', and the value is the name of the endpoint.
The two methods prefer to use tags because the IP segment may conflict. The tag method exists as a supplement to the rules.
EnsureThisValueIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo1: Please Ensure the Value is Greater Than or Equal to 1
EnsureThisValueIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo3: Please make sure this value is equal to or greater than 3
EnsureThisValueIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo5: Please ensure this value is greater than or equal to 5
EnsureThisValueIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo6: Please ensure this value is greater than or equal to 6
EnterMessage: Enter a question, Press Enter to send
EsIndex: ES provides a default index: jumpserver. If you enable index creation by date, the input value will serve as an index prefix
FullySynchronousHelpTips: If the asset conditions do not meet the matching policy rules, should we continue to sync these assets?
GatewayProtocolHelpText: SSH Gateway, supports proxy for SSH, RDP and VNC
GroupsHelpMessage: Please enter user groups, use comma for multiple groups (existing groups required)
HasImportErrorItemMsg: If there are failed imports, click on the x on the left to view the reasons for failure, after editing the table, you can continue to import failed items
HelpDocumentTip: You can change the website navigation bar Help -> Document url
HelpSupportTip: You can change the URL of the website navigation bar Help -> Support
HostnameStrategy: Used to generate asset hostnames. For example: 1. Instance name (instanceDemo); 2. Instance name and part of IP (last two digits) (instanceDemo-250.1)
IdeaContent: I would like you to act as a Linux terminal. I will enter commands, and you will respond with what the terminal should display. I want you to reply with terminal output only in a unique block of code, nothing else. Don't write explanations. When I need to tell you something, I will put the text in curly braces {note text}.

IdpMetadataUrlHelpText: Loading IDP Metadata from Remote Address

InAssetDetail: Update account information in asset details

InsecureCommandNotifyToSubscription: Dangerous command notification has been upgraded to message subscription, supporting more notification methods
InviteUserInOrg: Invite user to join this organization
Ips: Please enter a comma-separated group of IP addresses

MFAOfUserFirstLoginPersonalInformationIm:
Enable multi-factor authentication to make your account more secure.
After enabling, you will enter the multi-factor authentication binding process the next time you log in; You can also directly bind it in (Personal Information -> Quick Modifications -> Change Multi-Factor Settings)!
MFAOfUserFirstLoginUserGuidePage:
To protect your and your company's safety, please properly safeguard your account, password, key, and other important sensitive information; (e. g.: set a complex password, and enable multi-factor authentication)
Email, mobile number, WeChat and other personal information are only used for user authentication and platform internal message notification.
Name: Name

RuleRelationHelpTips: And: When all conditions are met, the action will be executed; Or: If one condition is met, the action will be executed
RunasPolicyHelpText: What account selection strategy should be adopted when there is no such running user on the current asset. Skip: Don't execute. Prioritize privileged accounts: If there is a privileged account, choose the privileged account first, if not, choose the ordinary account. Only privileged accounts: Only select from privileged accounts, if none, do not execute
RunningPathHelpText: Enter the script's runtime path, this setting only applies to shell scripts

The starting path of SFTP, home directory can be filled in: HOME.
Support variables: ${ACCOUNT} connected account username, ${USER} current user username, such as /tmp/${ACCOUNT}
SameAccountTip: Accounts with the same username as the authorized person
SameTypeAccountTip: Account with the same username and key type already exists
SaveSuccessContinueMsg: Creation successful, you can continue to add after updating the content
SearchAncestorNodePerm: Simultaneously search for authorizations on the current node and ancestor nodes
SecurityInsecureCommand: If enabled, email alerts will be sent when dangerous commands are run on the assets
SecurityInsecureCommandEmailReceiver: When there are multiple emails, they are separated by a comma ','
SelectAssetsMessage: Select the assets on the left, select system users to run, execute commands in batches
SelectAtLeastOneAssetOrNodeErrMsg: Choose at least one asset or node
SelectKeyOrCreateNew: Select Tag Key or Create New
SelectValueOrCreateNew: Select Tag Value or Create New
SetAdDomainNoDisabled: Create a regular account on the asset using the privileged account, the AD domain name cannot be modified if set (Windows)
SettingInEndpointHelpText: Configure service address and port in System Settings / Component Settings / Service Endpoints.

StrategyHelpTips: Determine the unique attributes of assets (such as platforms) according to policy priority. When multiple configurations are allowed for asset attributes (like nodes), all policy actions will be adopted
Subject: Theme
SudoHelpMessage: Use comma to separate multiple commands, such as: /bin/whoami,/sbin/ifconfig
SupportedProtocolHelpText: Set the protocol supported by the asset, you can modify the custom configuration for the protocol by clicking the set button, such as SFTP directory, RDP AD domain, etc.
SwitchToUserListTips: When connecting to assets through the following users, the current system user will be used to log in and then switch.
SymbolSetHelpText: Please input the special symbol set supported by this type of database. If the generated random password contains special characters not supported by this type of database, the password change plan will fail
SystemUserListHelpMessage:
System User is the account used by JumpServer when logging into assets, for example root `ssh root@host`, rather than using this username to log into assets (ssh admin@host);
Privileged User is an already existing asset, and the JumpServer uses this user to `push system users`,`get hardware information` etc;
Regular User can either exist in advance on the assets or can be automatically created by the Privileged User.
TableColSettingInfo: Please select the detailed information you want to display.
TempPassword: Temporary password is valid for 300 seconds, and expires immediately after use
TemplateHelpText: When Selecting Template to Add, It Will Automatically Create and Push Accounts That Do Not Exist Under Assets
TerminateTaskSendSuccessMsg: End Task has been issued, please refresh and check later
TestAllSystemUsersConnective: Test connectivity of all system users
TestGatewayHelpMessage: If you are using NAT port mapping, please set to the actual listening port of SSH
TestHelpText: Please enter the destination address for testing
TestLdapLoginSubtitle: Please submit LDAP configuration before testing login
TestSelectedSystemUsersConnective: Test Connectivity of Selected System Users
TimeoutHelpText: When this value is -1, no timeout time is specified
Title: Title
UnbindHelpText: Local users are users from this auth source and cannot be unlinked
UniqueError: Only one of the following properties can be set
UnselectedAssets: No Assets Selected or the Selected Assets Do Not Support SSH Protocol
UpdateAccountMsg: Please update the account information of the system user
UploadCsvLth10MHelpText: Only csv/xlsx can be uploaded, and it should not exceed 10M
UploadFileLthHelpText: Only files smaller than {limit}MB are allowed to upload
UploadZipTips: Please upload files in zip format
UserLoginACLHelpMsg: When logging in to the system, you can audit based on the user's login IP and time slot to determine if they can log in to the system (applies globally)
UsernameHelpMessage: The username is dynamic and logs in to the asset using the current user's username
UsernameOfCreateUpdatePage: The username of the user on the target host; if it exists, modify the user password; if it does not, add the user and set a password
VariableHelpText: You can use {{ key }} in the command to read built-in variables
VaultHelpText:
1. You need to enable Vault storage in the configuration file due to security reasons.
2. Once enabled, fill in other configurations and conduct tests.
3. Carry out data synchronization; it is one-way only, from the local database to the remote Vault. Upon completion of the synchronization, the local database no longer stores the password, please backup your data.
4. After modifying the Vault settings for the second time, you will need to restart the service.
VerificationCodeSent: The verification code has been sent
WebHelpMessage: Web Type Assets Depend on Remote Applications, Please Configure Remote Applications in System Settings
WindowsPushHelpText: Windows Assets Do Not Support Key Pushing
